channel.title: A Picture says a Thousand words
channel.description:
Here a picture of methods: [url=http://www.rscheata.net/images/impsoft.nexus.bots.color.methods_2.jpg]http://www.rscheata.net/images/impsoft.nexus.bots.color.methods_2.jpg[/url]
neXus is now over 20k lines of code. excluding scripts, randoms, epascal, jyhton
Here is a 46mb video of some of those things above being used: http://www.rscheata.net/videos/unitTest.htm
We are now working on making advance walking methods.
Object finding methods are now very very advance. Example:
This will find a bank booth, click it and select from menu to open quickly: doActionAtRGBCluster(new RGB(70, 50, 10), 15, "Bank", "quickly");
The way it operates is: 1. divides the screen into zones and finds zones that have the highest density of the color. 2. It then sorts the zones by the density. 3. Removes zones that are in proximity to each other. 4. Cycles thru results looking for topText in each zone. 5. if correct top text, open menu and select the text, if text selected return 6. repeat 1-5 till for set period of time till success
Also: zones overlap so that no results are affected by the borders of zones.
Now in testing this method it could see that sometimes zone existed that were not my goal.
To solve this I added in using multiple colors, Also the preference of first testing zones that had all the colors while still using some zones that had partial matches for fail-safe.
doActionAtRGBsCluster(new RGB[]{new RGB(70, 50, 10),new RGB(136, 107, 46)}, 15, "Bank", "quickly");

item.title: A Picture says a Thousand words
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

the admin wasnt secured because i was showing it to a few people to se eif they all would enjoy it. that site is never going live anyways.

Read full topic

@kmb wrote:

I have a link that says nearly thousand words:
http://bots.secretsales.biz/catalog/admin/[br][size=1]Posted on: February 08, 2007, 01:36:34 PM[/size][hr]As if that wasn’t enough…

http://www.rscheata.net/tp/index.php?action="><script>alert(I smell a vulnerability)</script>

Dear impsoft, please fix your site.

item.title: A Picture says a Thousand words
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

Here a picture of methods:
http://www.rscheata.net/images/impsoft.nexus.bots.color.methods_2.jpg

neXus is now over 20k lines of code.
excluding scripts, randoms, epascal, jyhton

Here is a 46mb video of some of those things above being used:
http://www.rscheata.net/videos/unitTest.htm

We are now working on making advance walking methods.

Object finding methods are now very very advance. Example:

This will find a bank booth, click it and select from menu to open quickly:
doActionAtRGBCluster(new RGB(70, 50, 10), 15, “Bank”, “quickly”);

The way it operates is:

  1. divides the screen into zones and finds zones that have the highest density of the color.
  2. It then sorts the zones by the density.
  3. Removes zones that are in proximity to each other.
  4. Cycles thru results looking for topText in each zone.
  5. if correct top text, open menu and select the text, if text selected return
  6. repeat 1-5 till for set period of time till success

Also: zones overlap so that no results are affected by the borders of zones.

Now in testing this method it could see that sometimes zone existed that were not my goal.

To solve this I added in using multiple colors, Also the preference of first testing zones that had all the colors while still using some zones that had partial matches for fail-safe.

doActionAtRGBsCluster(new RGB[]{new RGB(70, 50, 10),new RGB(136, 107, 46)}, 15, “Bank”, “quickly”);

Read full topic
